intro: Prestonia premontana, commonly known as the Montane Prestonia, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes milkweeds and other related species. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that are typically pink or red in color. It thrives in humid, shaded environments, often found in cloud forests and mountainous regions. Its ornamental value makes it a sought-after plant in horticulture, though it requires specific care to flourish.
